description: a(n)-th Fibonorial number (product of first a(n) nonzero Fibonacci numbers) - 1 is prime.
comments: The a(n)-th almost-Fibonorial number is prime.
links: Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Fibonorial [From _Eric W. Weisstein_, Dec 01 2009]
mathematica: a = 1; Do[ a = a*Fibonacci[n]; If[ PrimeQ[a - 1], Print[n] ], {n, 1, 247} ]
author: _Robert G. Wilson v_, Feb 07 2001
